div1.p: The bearer Mr. John Little of Westmoreland County in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania about to remove down the River to the Province of Texas wishes a certificate of his Character etc
I the subscriber do hereby certify that I have known said John Little for more than twenty years and know him to be an, honest, sober, orderly Citizen April 6th 1822

I James K. Butler Prothonotary of the Courts of Common pleas in and for the County of Allegheny, in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania Do hereby Certify that I am intimately acquainted with Andrw Boggs, who has in his own proper handwriting given the above certificate and subscribed his name thereto, That he is a man of strict truth and integrity, to all whose certificates and acts faith and credit are due.

In Testimony whereof I have hereunto set my hand and affixed the seal of the said Court at Pittsburgh this tenth day of April in the year of our lord Eighteen hundred twenty two - and of the sovereignty and Independence of the United States of America, the forty sixth.
